head.title: Metro Briefing | New York: Albany: New Chairman For Development Corporation

hedline.hl1: Metro Briefing | New York: Albany: New Chairman For Development Corporation
hedline.hl2: Albany: New Chairman for Development Corporation

body.head.byline: By DANNY HAKIM; Compiled by John Sullivan

abstract.p: Gov Eliot Spitzer names Avi Schick chairman of Lower Manhattan Development Corp, which is overseeing rebuilding at ground zero; names David Emil as its president (S)

block.p: Gov. Eliot Spitzer has named Avi Schick the chairman of the Lower Manhattan Development Corporation, which is overseeing the rebuilding at ground zero, and has named David Emil the corporation's president. Mr. Schick is president of the Empire State Development Corporation, the state's economic development agency, and was a deputy attorney general under Mr. Spitzer. Mr. Emil owned Windows on the World, the restaurant on top of the World Trade Center. Mr. Schick, whose salary in the state job is $213,000, will not be further compensated; Mr. Emil's annual salary will be $185,000.

Gov. Eliot Spitzer has named Avi Schick the chairman of the Lower Manhattan Development Corporation, which is overseeing the rebuilding at ground zero, and has named David Emil the corporation’s president. Mr. Schick is president of the Empire State Development Corporation, the state’s economic development agency, and was a deputy attorney general under Mr. Spitzer. Mr. Emil owned Windows on the World, the restaurant on top of the World Trade Center. Mr. Schick, whose salary in the state job is $213,000, will not be further compensated; Mr. Emil’s annual salary will be $185,000.
